intro: Pholidia ionantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pholidia ionantha is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a significant role in the local ecosystem.
